description: From Latin septuagenarius (“containing 70”) + -an (“forming adjectives and representative nouns”), either directly or via French septuagénaire, from Latin septuageni (“70 each”) + -arius (“-ary”), from Latin septuāginta (“seven tens, 70”).

examples: Coordinate terms: vicenarian, tricenarian, quadragenarian, quinquagenarian, semicentenarian, hexagenerian, sexagenarian, octogenarian, nonagenarian, centenarian, supercentenarian

entries.meaning: Synonym of seventysomething: a person between 70 and 79 years old.
examples: For a ley hunter, local people – particularly the elderly – can be mines of information. Devereux and Thomson recount how they asked a septuagenarian in a remote village the location of an elusive stone, without mentioning the subject of leys:  […]
